problem: A 1000-kg car rounds a curve on a flat road of radius 50 m at a speed of 15 m/s (54 km/h). Will the car follow the curve, or will it skid? Assume: (a) the pavement is dry and the coefficient of static friction is μₛ = 0.60; (b) the pavement is icy and μₛ = 0.25.

variables.meaning: coefficient of static friction, dry pavement
coefficient of static friction, icy pavement

correctFormulas.name: No-skid condition on a flat curve

steps.explanation: Only static friction provides the horizontal force necessary for circular motion on a flat road.
Compute the acceleration required to keep the car on the circular path.
Translate that acceleration into the minimum coefficient of static friction.
Compare the available coefficients to the requirement.
steps.notations: μ₍s,dry₎ = 0.60 > 0.46 → car follows curve; μ₍s,ice₎ = 0.25 < 0.46 → car skids

steps.explanation: State the outcome for each surface condition.
steps.notations: Dry pavement: safe. Icy pavement: insufficient friction, car slides outward.
